Posts.Content: Hi, I have read as much as I can find on fasting, especially Dr Volta Longo, it made me feel empowered to think there is something that just might help me through chemo. Anyway, I have just completed 6 rounds of FEC-T (today was my last one woohoo) and have “fasted” for 3 days prior and 24hrs after each treatment. I did a keto fast with a bit of vege juice to keep my strength and nutrient intake up. A full-on water fast would have too much for me! I didn’t loose any weight as i probably over compensated on the days afterward. Overall I’m very happy I did the fast, mainly because it made me feel positive and in fighter mode. I haven’t had many side effects throughout, a touch of nausea and tiredness for the first 4-5 days. Of course, I have no way of knowing what my symptoms would have been had i not fasted.  I have met quite a few women (who didn’t fast or do anything “alternative”) who have found chemo doable, with mild side effects, and I’m sure it’s the positive attitude and trying to keep chipper and do nice fun things despite all the crappy stuff, that helps.
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy and fasting

Posts.Content: Hi Kaz K I have just had round 5 of FEC-T. I lost all my hair on FEC apart from eyebrows and eyelashes.  After the last round of FEC I noticed some definite regrowth of head hair, just a bit of stubble so I'm still wearing my wig! My wig is starting to look more like a wig because some bits of hair have come off near the front, showing the netting underneath, gah! I have lost a few lashes on T and my eyebrows are thinner, but bizarrely I am growing new baby eyelashes at the same time as a couple of strands coming out. Hi Jammy R Good luck for round 5 tomorrow, it's a great feeling to be nearly done with this step. And hooray for hair starting to regrow!
Posts.Title: Docetaxel and hair loss

Posts.Content: Hi Springrose I am 7 weeks post finishing my last round of "T" chemo and my hair has started to grow back at the sides, but the top is very thin and patchy. It started to regrow after the last round of FEC and I would say it would be about 0.5 inch in the areas that it has grown. It has that slate grey look that someone else mentioned. I really hope that changes! As for my eyelashes and brows, I lost I'd say 70% of those during the T phase and they are very slow to come back. I have some eyelashes still falling out where others are regrowing!  Good luck!
Posts.Title: Of hair regrowth after chemo ....

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I am new to this forum and wanted to say hi. I was diagnosed back in January and am having neo-adjuvant chemotherapy. I have a 3cm lump (with satellite nodules whatever they are), ER and PR positive, HER2 negative, grade 2. I have had 3 rounds of FEC and 1 round of T so far, and all in all the side effects have been manageable. I had an MRI scan last week to check to see if the lump is shrinking and nervously waiting the results!  Has anyone in a similar situation to me had to wait long for MRI results, and could you feel that your lump had definitely shrunk? My oncologist examined me and said "hmmmm yes that feels smaller than 3cm", not very scientific but still, there's hope!
Posts.Title: Hello - new here and waiting on MRI results

Posts.Content: Good luck to those starting the chemo this month! For me the first was worse mainly because it's scary to start something new, and very emotional because the situation really hits home.  But the goods news is the time for me has gone so quickly, and I am about to have round 5 of FEC-T tomorrow. I'm strangely excited just to get there and just get it done. And I must say I enjoy having a good excuse to rest and have someone else do the kids kids tea and bedtime palarva!
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all, just wondering what other people's steroid dose is for those having the T? I was on 16mg twice a day, but just had it reduced to 12mg twice per day. I want to ask to reduce it further because I have that feeling like when you've drunk too much coffee!
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Staffylove I hope your first round of T goes ok! I have to say I didn't find it nearly as bad as they said it may be. In fact I found it easier than the FEC in a way because I didn't have any nausea with it. The worst part for me was an achy spasm in my back which came from the white blood cell injections. And I tended to get very down and despondent about 4-5 days after the treatment, like I'd totally lost all positivity. But luckily I bounced back with a bit of TLC.  Take care xx
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all Today is a good day, I have just finished chemo!!  I had 6 rounds of FEC-T and the side effects have all been mild. Although it’s too soon to say what the side effects from this final round will be, I’m having some chest pains and just watching and waiting at the moment to see if they magically go away! I am pre menopausal (age 35) and like others have been having hot flashes. I’ve had my usual period throughout although it hasn’t materialised this month, so that might be the end of that. Sad face. Still, I have two little beauties age 3 and 5 to take my mind off things and keep me busy. I have to say the worst part of all this is the worry and fear that gets you in the middle of the night. Physical side effects you can take a pill for. Anyway, I have done lots on my journey to keep my pecker up, meditation has been wonderful, and plenty of walking and treating to myself to fresh flowers just because. Wishing everyone healing vibes and peace (I’ve turned into a hippy haha)
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thanks JammyR I remembered you saying you were two days after me, good luck for Friday. I got my Picc line out today too, such a good feeling! Have you had your op? I’m having a mastectomy in 5 weeks time with immediate Diep. Then probably rads and tamoxifen for me.
Posts.Title: *** May 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Violet and JaneyMoon I also had back spasms after the white blood cell injections, although they disappeared after I finished the shots.  Just putting it out there as my onco had never heard of this as a side effect. Hope it gets sorted soon!
Posts.Title: Back spasms 9 weeks after DIEP

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I’m new here. I was diagnosed back in Feb and am on round 4 of FEC-T, I’m having chemo before the op so I’m nervously waiting for shrinkage! Side effects haven’t been too bad for me so far, although the tiredness is hard work with my two little ones to look after, still, they keep me smiling. Anyway, goodnight, here’s to some restorative sleep tonight  X
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all It seems there is a lot of conflicting advice about taking supplements. I take a herbal blend plus some vit D and pro biotics which I was told were fine. I also do acupuncture and juice fasting, the acupuncture really helps with my stress levels but is so expensive! By the way, how much time do others get with their oncologist? I get a rushed few minutes, I've never had a good long chat with them really. But then again I see them every 3 weeks before each cycle. Cycle 5 for me this Wednesday, my second dose of the T. Side effects have been manageable so far so fingers crossed.  Good luck to all!
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***
